New Records: Edwin Uceta received a three-game suspension for intentionally hitting Nick Castellanos with a fastball.
The Phillies won the game 9-4 against the Tampa Bay Rays.
Key Match Events: The benches cleared after Nick Castellanos was hit by a pitch and both teams exchanged heated words.
The Rays reliever Edwin Uceta was ejected from the game after the hit-by-pitch incident.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies held an 8.0-game lead over the New York Mets in the NL East and had the best record in baseball before the game.
The Phillies' chemistry and camaraderie were on display during the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Edwin Uceta received a three-game suspension from Major League Baseball for intentionally hitting Nick Castellanos.
The Phillies won the game 9-4 and extended their lead in the NL East.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was significant in terms of team momentum and chemistry for the Phillies as they approached the postseason.
Nick Castellanos got his revenge in the next game with a two-run home run.
